geekyMoa

Front end developer @ Stormfors

Standards-thumpin’, divitis-squashin’, sass-lovin’, js-gobblin’ front-end-oriented web developer who likes to dabble in all ends, back, middle, and front. In an ongoing love/hate triangle with Drupal and WordPress.

  • How to Succeed in Open Source (or Things I Learned from Writing My First Rules Condition)

    01 December 2011
    My colleague Mattias keeps giving me one piece of great advice that I just keep forgetting. When you want to accomplish something, look at a piece of code that already does sort of what you want to do, copy and paste it, and modify it to work like you want it to.

We had an interesting discussion over lunch about this that mostly dealt with experiences during childhood, even though it somehow degraded into space cowboys…

  • Drupal vs WordPress

    31 August 2011

    I have received a few quips about working with Drupal and yet using WordPress for my blog. To that I say, use whatever fits best for the project you’re working on.
